item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "Explaining something makes it go away, so to speak; what's important is left after you have explained everything else." -- Edward Gorey

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Words! Mere words! How terrible they were! How clear, and vivid, and cruel! One could not escape from them. And yet what a subtle magic there was in them! They seemed to be able to give a plastic form to formless things, and to have a music of their own as sweet as that of viol or of lute. Mere words! Was there anything so real as words?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Philip José Farmer
item.description: "Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got." -- Philip José Farmer

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Judy Garland
item.description: "Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else." -- Judy Garland

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "Books, Cats, Life is Good." -- Edward Gorey

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "I am a person before I am anything else. I never say I am a writer. I never say I am an artist...I am a person who does those things." -- Edward Gorey
